business.headline: Switzerland cancels 'most favoured nation' status to India over Nestle ruling The Swiss government has suspended the MFN clause in its tax treaty with India, potentially leading to higher taxes on Indian companies operating in Switzerland. This move follows a Supreme Court ruling affecting the interpretation of the MFN clause.
Bill Gates to go bankrupt? Tesla CEO Elon Musk explains howElon Musk claims Bill Gates could face bankruptcy over his alleged Tesla short position if the company dominates globally.
Uncovered: Network of suspected scam sites lure 'dabba' tradersIndia Today uncovers a web of suspected scammer sites posing as platforms for the "dabba" stock trade, an illegal practice.

Oh Gary, how could you: Elon Musk mocks US body amid Twitter stock probeA letter from Elon Musk's attorney, Alex Spiro, addressed to outgoing US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) Chair Gary Gensler, alleged that the agency gave Musk a 48-hour ultimatum.
Sensex, Nifty rebound to end higher; FMCG and IT stocks lead recoveryThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 843.16 points to close at 82,133.12, while the NSE Nifty50 added 219.60 points to end at 24,768.30.
EPFO key amendments: Now faster claims and more interest benefits for membersEPFO's amendments focus on reducing delays, quicker claims, and better interest benefits for its members.

Sensex gains 700 points: 3 reasons behind stock market volatility todayStock market rebound: The S&P BSE Sensex was up 730.39 points to 82,020.35, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 192.70 points to 24,741.40, as of 3 PM.

Mobikwik IPO listing: Does GMP suggest strong market debut amid heavy demand?Mobikwik IPO has seen very strong demand among investors and was fully booked within the first hour of opening for subscription.
Sensex back in green: Airtel, HUL, and IT stocks lead market rebound As of 12:52 PM, Sensex was up by 111.46 points to 81,401.42, while Nifty50 gained 12.75 points to 24,561.45.

Vishal Mega Mart IPO last day: Check gmp, subscription. Shoud you subscribe?Vishal Mega Mart IPO has set a price range of Rs 74 to Rs 78 per share. Retail investors need to purchase a minimum of 190 shares in a single lot, requiring an initial investment of Rs 14,820.
Azim Premji, Ranjan Pai to buy a minority stake in Akasa Air: ReportAzim Premji and Ranjan Pai family offices acquired a minority stake in Akasa Air as part of a $130-140 million fundraising round.
Explained: Why a credit score over 800 mattersHigh credit scores boost financial health by offering cheaper loans, and better insurance discounts, amongst others.

Gold, silver price today, December 13, 2024: Precious metals witness dip on MCXGold Price Today December 13, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the lower side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Friday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

Sensex falls 1,000 points: Key factors behind stock market weaknessStock market crash: As of 10:37 AM, the Sensex was down 1,064.37 points to 80,225.59, while Nifty was also struggling below 24,300 losing 332.10 points to 24,216.60.
Sensex, Nifty tank in early trade; inflation relief fails to lift market moodThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 540.09 points to 80,749.87, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 160.35 points to 24,388.35.

Mahila Samman Yojana: Key details about Rs 1000 schemeThe AAP government announced Mahila Samman Yojana, offering Rs 1000 monthly to women in Delhi, with a rise to Rs 2100 if it wins in the upcoming elections.

Retail inflation cools to 5.48% in November from 6.21% in OctoberHouseholds across the world's most populous country are likely to welcome the inflation relief, given that food expenses dominate many family budgets.
Sensex, Nifty end lower ahead of inflation data; bearish trend persistsThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 236.18 points to close at 81,289.96, while the Nifty50 was down 93.10 points to end at 24,548.70.
December 15 advance tax deadline: What you need to knowTaxpayers with liabilities exceeding Rs 10,000 are required to make quarterly advance tax payments to avoid penalties and interest charges.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Amit Shah's pitch for One Nation One Election in first interview since 2024 winUnion Home Minister, in his first media interaction after the BJP's win in Lok Sabha polls, dismissed allegations that the 'One Nation One Election' bill undermines the principles of federalism.

In Constitution debate, PM Modi lists 11 resolutions for IndiaPrime Minister Narendra Modi listed 11 resolutions for the future of India while responding to the Constitution debate in the Lok Sabha on Saturday.

What OpenAI whistleblower revealed about company weeks before his deathJust weeks before his death in November, Suchir Balaji, a former OpenAI researcher, levelled serious allegations against the artificial intelligence company.

IND vs AUS, 3rd Test Day 2 LIVE: Nitish Reddy ends Labuschagne's long vigilIND vs AUS, 3rd Test Day 2 Live: Nitish Reddy dismissed Marnus Labuschagne as he got him caught at second slip. Steve Smith and Labuschgne survived a menacing spell from Jasprit Bumrah and were slowly building a good partnership. Earlier, Bumrah looked at his best on Day 2 as he got the first strike of the day by dismissing Usman Khawaja caught behind for 21. He further got rid of Nathan McSweeney getting him caught at slips to send both openers back in the pavilion.

What distinguishes Ram from Ravan, actor Varun Dhawan asked. Amit Shah said…Actor Dhawan lauded Amit Shah as the 'Hanuman of the country' for his selfless service and praised the clarity of his answer to his question about the difference between Ram and Ravan.

Congress reacts to PM Modi's speech: Distorian, puts WhatsApp University to shamePM Modi said the Congress, having "tasted blood", repeatedly wounded the Constitution while his government's policies and decisions since it took office in 2014 have been aimed at boosting India's strength and unity.

Congress will never be able to erase taint of Emergency: PM's big attackPrime Minister Narendra Modi, responding to the Constitution debate, said the Congress strangled democracy by turning the country into a 'jailhouse'.

Dr Naresh Trehan recommends cutting out these 4 'whites' from your dietDr Naresh Trehan, Chairman of Medanta Hospital, highlighted the importance of a balanced lifestyle for longevity, advocating moderation in diet and regular exercise for heart health.

IND vs AUS: Rishabh Pant emulates MS Dhoni, completes unique 150 at GabbaRishabh Pant emulated MS Dhoni during the Gabba Test as he reached 150 dismissals as a wicketkeeper for the Indian team. Pant reached the landmark after he took the catch of Usman Khawaja on Day 2 of the ongoing match.
Nehru model failed India, course correction underway since 2014: S JaishankarJaishankar slammed the enduring influence of Nehru-era policies, calling for a "course correction" at home and abroad.

Man reports 'missing fingers', then admits to chopping them off to skip workAn accountant's bizarre confession shocked Surat Police. Initially claiming his fingers vanished mysteriously, Mayur Tarapara later admitted cutting them off himself to escape a job he despised.

Call 1930: Amit Shah's advice for digital arrest menaceSpeaking at Agenda Aaj Tak in his first media interaction post the Lok Sabha polls victory, Union Minister Amit Shah advised people to caution against the digital arrest menace.

Nehru, Indira, Rajiv, Sonia: PM Modi's big 'Constitution' attack on GandhisPrime Minister Narendra Modi, speaking in the Lok Sabha, said the seeds of changing the Constitution were sown by Jawaharlal Nehru, and it was followed up by Indira Gandhi.

Rahul Gandhi's Savarkar offensive, BJP counters with Indira Gandhi letterRahul Gandhi, participating in the debate on the Constitution in the Lok Sabha, said Hindutva ideologue Vinayak Damodar Savarkar believed the Constitution should be superseded by the Manusmriti.

Kolkata woman killed, body dismembered by brother-in-law for rejecting advancesKolkata Police arrested Atiur Laskar for murdering his sister-in-law, Khadeja Bibi, after she rejected his advances. He confessed to dismembering her body into three parts, which were recovered from different locations.

Video: Bihar government teacher kidnapped, forced to marry woman at gunpointAvnish Kumar, a government teacher in Bihar, was allegedly held captive by some men when he was going to school and forced to marry a woman at gunpoint.

Delhi records highest number of good to moderate air quality days since 2018This year, Delhi recorded 207 'good to moderate' air quality days with an AQI below 100, the highest since 2018 excluding the Covid-19 pandemic's clear-air conditions in 2020.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Bhopal man outsmarts 'digital arrest' scammer, video goes viralA vigilant graphics designer from Bhopal thwarted a 'digital arrest' scam attempt by cleverly confronting a fraudster impersonating a police officer on a video call, exposing the scam.

Did 'Abki baar 400 paar' slogan hurt BJP in Lok Sabha polls? What Amit Shah said Union Home Minister Amit Shah said, in what was his first media interaction after the Lok Sabha elections, that although the BJP had won fewer seats in the elections, their mission has not changed.

Watch: Virat Kohli teases Harbhajan with 'naino mein sapna' dance step at The GabbaVirat Kohli lightened up a rain-hit Day 1 at The Gabba by teasing Harbhajan Singh for his outfit, comparing it to Jeetendra's Himmatwala look. Kohli even broke into the Naino Mein Sapna dance, leaving everyone in splits.

No prior permission needed to prosecute cops who file false cases: Supreme CourtThe Supreme Court ruled that prior sanction is not required to prosecute police officers accused of filing false cases or fabricating evidence, as such 'abuse of power' cannot be considered part of their official duties.

Kolkata doctor's father slams 'CBI's failure' after bail to two accusedJunior doctors and the Kolkata rape victim's parents marched towards the CBI office to express their outrage over the bail granted to the suspects.

Worry about the genes you inherit, not property: Liver specialist Dr SK SarinHepatologist Dr SK Sarin, speaking at Agenda Aaj Tak, urged people to look for inherited diseases and not wealth to assess a person's health horoscope.

Andrew Garfield asked me about Hindi films, Zoya Akhtar: Shraddha KapoorShraddha Kapoor spoke about her recent meeting with Andrew Garfield at the Red Sea Film Festival. She shared that the Hollywood actor enquired about Hindi cinema and specifically mentioned Zoya Akhtar.

Taapsee Pannu reveals she got married in 2023, not 2024Actor Taapsee Pannu surprised fans by revealing that she had married her longtime partner Mathias Boe in December 2023. The couple opted for a private court marriage last year.

Viral: Allu Arjun's sweet gesture for Rana Daggubati as he finishes phone callIn a heartwarming moment captured at Allu Arjun's residence, the actor was seen warmly embracing Rana Daggubati upon his release from jail on Saturday. Several videos of their union have gone viral on social media.

Rekha hugs Amitabh Bachchan's grandson Agastya Nanda at RK Film FestivalAt the RK Film Festival, actor Rekha shared a heartfelt hug with Amitabh Bachchan's grandson, Agastya Nanda, a moment that touched the hearts of attendees and fans alike. A video of their interaction is going viral online.

The ICC has approved a hybrid model for the Champions Trophy, allowing matches to be hosted in both Pakistan and Dubai.

I want to play Test cricket, win more matches for Team India: Arshdeep SinghSpeaking at the 'Champions' session of Agenda AajTak on Saturday, December 14, left-arm fast bowler Arshdeep Singh said he is keen on playing Test cricket. WPL 2025: Uncapped Indians who could set the mini-auction on fire WPL 2025: 82 uncapped Indian players will go under the hammer when the upcoming mini-auction takes place on Sunday, December 15 in Bengaluru. Overall, five teams have 120 players to pick from to fill 19 slots.

Rajat Patidar 'happy' to lead RCB if given an opportunityIPL 2025: Rajat Patidar is ready to take on the role of captain at Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) if given the opportunity. RCB retained Rajat ahead of the IPL auction.

BBL 2024-25: Squads, schedule, live-streaming and all you need to knowBBL 2024-25: Five-time champion Perth Scorchers and Melbourne Stars will face each other in the opening game on December 15. 40 matches will take place in the league stage before the playoffs and final. Brisbane Heat are the defending champions.

AUS vs IND: Sara Tendulkar marks attendance at The Gabba on washed out Day 1Sara Tendulkar attended Day 1 of the 3rd Test between Australia and India at The Gabba in Brisbane. The opening day was washed out due to intense rain in Brisbane.

Ange Postecoglou defends Tottenham Hotspur ownership amid club's strugglesTottenham Hotspur manager Ange Postecoglou said that the club's ownership must not be blamed for their on-field struggles. Spurs are ranked 11th in the Premier League points table after 15 games.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
